conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and how it will be directed into the containers E, F, or G.
Baffle A is on the left side and is vertical.
Baffle B is on the top and is horizontal.
Baffle C is on the right side and is vertical.
Baffle D is on the top and is horizontal.
The liquid will flow down if it is above the baffle and up if it is below the baffle.
The liquid will flow to the right if it is to the left of the baffle and to the left if it is to the right of the baffle.
The liquid will flow up if it is below the baffle and down if it is above the baffle.
The liquid will flow to the left if it is to the right of the baffle and to the right if it is to the left of the baffle.

premise: Liquid from A flows down through Baffle A.
Liquid from B flows to the right through Baffle B.
Liquid from C flows up through Baffle C.
Liquid from D flows to the left through Baffle D.
Liquid from A flows down through Baffle A.
conclusion: Liquid from A will flow into container E.

premise: Liquid from B flows to the right through Baffle B.
conclusion: Liquid from B will flow into container F.

premise: Liquid from C flows up through Baffle C.
conclusion: Liquid from C will flow into container G.

conclusion: Liquid from D will flow into container E.
